channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter everywhere behind LBB recycling bins, 3rd September
item.description:
Norman Park: grass area behind recycling bins is covered in unsightly litter and rubbish from the bins, there is also an abandoned bike, Please can you attend ASAP and tidy area, it’s currently reflecting badly on the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Huge dips in surface- getting worse
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodhurst Avenue, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven pavement, 3rd September
item.description:
We have a problem with the pavement pooling about a sq meter of water by the front gate. This make it difficult to push the baby buggy out without getting wet. Would appreciate it being leveled to stop flooding in my property. May I also raise the poor state of all the pavement between Norwood road and Turney Road. It is a patchwork to botched fixes and has not been surfaced in over 30 years! Stop patching and just resurface the whole thing!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 267, Croxted Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Soul Town flyposter on traffic signal, High St Beckenham jct Manor Rd, 3rd September
item.description:
The Soul Town Festival company that is hiring Beckenham Recreation Ground from Bromley Council on 6/9/25 is also flyposting on street furniture. Please fine this company and withdraw permission for this event being advertised by criminal processes. Flyposting is a criminal offence. I attach a photo of their flyposter on a traffic signal at the junction of High St, Beckenham and Manor Rd (also a conservation area) seen today 3/9/25 and one previously reported a week ago in Croydon Rd, Beckenham on a lamp column. Flyposting of the Soul Town Festival took place last year eg. on traffic lights and lamp columns in Anerley Rd. If Bromley Council and IdVerde parks contractor are profiting from Soul Town Festival, part of those profits are being made from flyposting, a criminal offence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two large bins, 3rd September
item.description:
These are situated next to Burney Street practice and do not appear to belong to anyone, (I enquired at the practice) please remove

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49-55, Burney Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large hole covered by grass, 3rd September
item.description:
I parked at the end of Rippersly Road, as I stepped out of my car I stepped out of my car onto the grass verge I fell over twisting my ankle very badly and hitting my elbow and back as I fell. I was unable to walk or move due to the injury and the severe pain caused. When I looked down I saw the cause was a large hole, covered in grass so it could not be seen by anyone.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rippersley Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on shop shutter at 7 Stockwell Road SW9. Located near Stockwell tube station, 3rd September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a shop shutter at 7 Stockwell Road SW9 situated near Stockwell tube station. The shop is called 'Taste More Chicken' the graffiti is fairly large done in purple spray paint against a black background. The graffiti has been there for over 3 months. Please can it be painted over. The are also more graffiti tags also in close proximity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13-15, Stockwell Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Complaint – Homeless Encampment Under Stairwell at De Beauvoir Estate, 3rd September
item.description:
A homeless person has been living under the stairwell by the river next to De Beauvoir Estate for the past two weeks, leaving rubbish and litter everywhere. The stairwell has been completely taken over, it is unhygienic, eyesore, & residents are concerned

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
